elements.title: Aphaena submaculata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Aphaena submaculata (pictured) uses specialized mouthparts to suck the sap of trees?

elements.title: Canadian peacekeepers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Canadian peacekeepers participated in every UN peacekeeping effort from its inception until 1989?

elements.title: Cornelius N. Dorsette (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1890 Cornelius N. Dorsette, often referred to as the first African-American physician in Alabama, founded Hale Infirmary, a hospital for Black patients and staff in Montgomery?

elements.title: Potteries derby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one Potteries derby game was decided by a goal scored twelve seconds into the match?

elements.title: Louisa Mak (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hong Kong actress and beauty pageant winner Louisa Mak is a Cambridge law graduate?

elements.title: Biological Cosmic Ray Experiment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as part of the Apollo 17 Biological Cosmic Ray Experiment, the heads of five mice were each cut into 1600 slices to look for brain lesions?

elements.title: Johnny Buss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that U.S. presidential candidate Johnny Buss owns one of the oldest comedy clubs in the country?

elements.title: 2023–24 College Football Playoff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Florida State's exclusion from the 2023–24 College Football Playoff prompted an antitrust investigation?

elements.title: parachuted from airplanes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that beavers, mules, and dogs have been parachuted from airplanes?
